intro: Silene talyschensis, commonly known as the Talysch Mountain Catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Silene talyschensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for small invertebrates.
